Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The KA Steel Lemont, Bleach facility, is committed to the safety and well-being of its employees, neighboring community, and the environment.  KA Steel is an active member of the Chlorine Institute, an industry group that develops technology for the safe handling and management of chlorine.  



Stationary Source

The site produces sodium hypochlorite (bleach) from chlorine and sodium hydroxide (caustic).  These chemicals provide important benefits in critical applications such as water purification and household disinfectants.  KA Steel's policy is to implement reasonable measures to prevent a release of a hazardous material from occurring, to provide early detection of a release in the unlikely event that one would occur, and to have in place a contingency plan to respond promptly yet safely to such a release.

Regulated Substances Handled

This Risk Management Plan has been prepared to address the handling of chlorine at the KA Steel Lemont Bleach facility.

Liquefied chlorine is received in 90-ton rail cars and used in the manufacture of bleach.  Customers use bleach to treat drinking water, wastewater, swimming pool water and industrial water to eliminate and/or prevent the growth of harmful organisms.

Accidental Release Prevention Program

KA Steel has a comprehensive release prevention program, meeting the Federal RMP Prevention Program and OSHA Process Safety Management ("PSM") requirements.  We have physical safeguards in place to prevent a release of chlorine.  We also follow best industry practices for the design and construction of equipment, piping and instrumentation.  Our process design includes expansion bottles and/or rupture disks and pressure switches to safeguard against hydrostatic overpressure of equipment and piping.



Five Year Accident History

The 5-year accidental release history as described in 40 CFR 68.42(a) must include all accidental releases from covered processes that

resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



The Lemont Bleach Plant has not had any releases in its 5-year history meeting that definition.  All releases are tracked through RC Alert, which is the sites online incident tracking tool.  Investigations are managed online and any resulting corrective and preventative actions are tracked to closure using SAP.  



Emergency Response Program

KA Steel has a comprehensive emergency response program that includes the installation of detection, alarm, shutdown, containment and scrubbing systems to halt and/or mitigate a release.  In the unlikely event that a release cannot be controlled completely with these systems, KA Steel has an Emergency Response Team trained and equipped to respond safely to a release in accordance with a written Emergency Response Plan.  KA Steel has worked closely with the Lemont Fire Department in developing its Emergency Response Plan.  



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

KA Steel has made significant changes to improve safety, including the expansion of both the coverage and functionality of the chlorine monitor system, the addition of video surveillance cameras, upgrades to the chlorine vent and disposal system and additional interlocks and automatic shutdown devices.
